channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Hierarchical Federated Learning with Multi-Timescale Gradient Correction
item.description: Our key idea is to introduce distinct control variables to (i) correct the client gradient towards the group gradient, i. e., to reduce client model drift caused by local updates based on individual datasets, and (ii) correct the group gradient towards the global gradient, i. e., to reduce group model drift caused by FL over clients within the group.

item.title: Ruler: A Model-Agnostic Method to Control Generated Length for Large Language Models
item.description: Specifically, Ruler equips LLMs with the ability to generate responses of a specified length based on length constraints within the instructions.

item.title: A Survey on the Honesty of Large Language Models
item.description: Honesty is a fundamental principle for aligning large language models (LLMs) with human values, requiring these models to recognize what they know and don't know and be able to faithfully express their knowledge.

item.title: When SAM2 Meets Video Camouflaged Object Segmentation: A Comprehensive Evaluation and Adaptation
item.description: This study presents a comprehensive study on SAM2's ability in VCOS.

item.title: MinerU: An Open-Source Solution for Precise Document Content Extraction
item.description: Document content analysis has been a crucial research area in computer vision.

item.title: Towards Diverse Device Heterogeneous Federated Learning via Task Arithmetic Knowledge Integration
item.description: This failure primarily stems from two issues: the dilution of informative logits from more capable devices by those from less capable ones, and the use of a single integrated logits as the distillation target across all devices, which neglects their individual learning capacities and and the unique contributions of each.

item.title: YOLOv8-ResCBAM: YOLOv8 Based on An Effective Attention Module for Pediatric Wrist Fracture Detection
item.description: Wrist trauma and even fractures occur frequently in daily life, particularly among children who account for a significant proportion of fracture cases.

item.title: AL-GTD: Deep Active Learning for Gaze Target Detection
item.description: In this paper, our goal is to reduce the reliance on the size of labeled training data for gaze target detection.

item.title: Autoregressive Policy Optimization for Constrained Allocation Tasks
item.description: Allocation tasks represent a class of problems where a limited amount of resources must be allocated to a set of entities at each time step.

item.title: Improving Visual Object Tracking through Visual Prompting
item.description: PiVOT proposes a prompt generation network with the pre-trained foundation model CLIP to automatically generate and refine visual prompts, enabling the transfer of foundation model knowledge for tracking.

item.title: RNC: Efficient RRAM-aware NAS and Compilation for DNNs on Resource-Constrained Edge Devices
item.description: The resulting network architecture can be optimized for either high accuracy or low latency using a one-shot neural network approach with Pareto optimality achieved through the Non-dominated Sorted Genetic Algorithm II (NSGA-II).

item.title: Space-time 2D Gaussian Splatting for Accurate Surface Reconstruction under Complex Dynamic Scenes
item.description: To tackle the dynamic contents and the occlusions in complex scenes, we present a space-time 2D Gaussian Splatting approach.

item.title: Cross-video Identity Correlating for Person Re-identification Pre-training
item.description: For example, compared with the previous state-of-the-art~\cite{ISR}, CION with the same ResNet50-IBN achieves higher mAP of 93. 3\% and 74. 3\% on Market1501 and MSMT17, while only utilizing 8\% training samples.

item.title: ARLBench: Flexible and Efficient Benchmarking for Hyperparameter Optimization in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: With the extensive and large-scale dataset on hyperparameter landscapes that our selection is based on, ARLBench is an efficient, flexible, and future-oriented foundation for research on AutoRL.

item.title: CycleNet: Enhancing Time Series Forecasting through Modeling Periodic Patterns
item.description: The stable periodic patterns present in time series data serve as the foundation for conducting long-horizon forecasts.

item.title: PhysGen: Rigid-Body Physics-Grounded Image-to-Video Generation
item.description: We present PhysGen, a novel image-to-video generation method that converts a single image and an input condition (e. g., force and torque applied to an object in the image) to produce a realistic, physically plausible, and temporally consistent video.

item.title: Underwater Image Enhancement with Physical-based Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models
item.description: Underwater vision is crucial for autonomous underwater vehicles (AUVs), and enhancing degraded underwater images in real-time on a resource-constrained AUV is a key challenge due to factors like light absorption and scattering, or the sufficient model computational complexity to resolve such factors.

item.title: Reducing Semantic Ambiguity In Domain Adaptive Semantic Segmentation Via Probabilistic Prototypical Pixel Contrast
item.description: Domain adaptation aims to reduce the model degradation on the target domain caused by the domain shift between the source and target domains.

item.title: Off to new Shores: A Dataset & Benchmark for (near-)coastal Flood Inundation Forecasting
item.description: Altogether, our dataset and benchmark provide a comprehensive platform for evaluating flood forecasts, enabling future solutions for this critical challenge.

item.title: MCUBench: A Benchmark of Tiny Object Detectors on MCUs
item.description: We introduce MCUBench, a benchmark featuring over 100 YOLO-based object detection models evaluated on the VOC dataset across seven different MCUs.

item.title: LW2G: Learning Whether to Grow for Prompt-based Continual Learning
item.description: To promote cross-task knowledge facilitation and form an effective and efficient prompt sets pool, we propose a plug-in module in the former stage to \textbf{Learn Whether to Grow (LW2G)} based on the disparities between tasks.

item.title: Prompt-Driven Temporal Domain Adaptation for Nighttime UAV Tracking
item.description: To address the issue, this work proposes a prompt-driven temporal domain adaptation training framework to fully utilize temporal contexts for challenging nighttime UAV tracking, i. e., TDA.

item.title: Enhanced Convolution Neural Network with Optimized Pooling and Hyperparameter Tuning for Network Intrusion Detection
item.description: This demonstrates the effectiveness of EnCNN in real-time network intrusion detection, offering a robust solution for identifying and mitigating security threats, and enhancing overall network resilience.

item.title: MG-Net: Learn to Customize QAOA with Circuit Depth Awareness
item.description: To address this dilemma, here we first analyze the convergence behavior of QAOA, uncovering the origins of this dilemma and elucidating the intricate relationship between the employed mixer Hamiltonian, the specific problem at hand, and the permissible maximum circuit depth.

item.title: LML: Language Model Learning a Dataset for Data-Augmented Prediction
item.description: In the process of DAP, the system uses the data summary to automatically create a query, which is used to retrieve relevant rows from the dataset.

item.title: Image-guided topic modeling for interpretable privacy classification
item.description: Predicting and explaining the private information contained in an image in human-understandable terms is a complex and contextual task.

item.title: Do We Need Domain-Specific Embedding Models? An Empirical Investigation
item.description: To account for the possibility that this drop is driven by FinMTEB's higher complexity, we propose four measures to quantify dataset complexity and control for this factor in our analysis.

item.title: Cottention: Linear Transformers With Cosine Attention
item.description: By leveraging the properties of cosine similarity and rearranging the attention equation, Cottention achieves native linear memory complexity with respect to sequence length, making it inherently more memory-efficient than softmax attention.

item.title: CurricuLLM: Automatic Task Curricula Design for Learning Complex Robot Skills using Large Language Models
item.description: Our core idea is that large language models (LLMs), with their extensive training on diverse language data and ability to encapsulate world knowledge, present significant potential for efficiently breaking down tasks and decomposing skills across various robotics environments.

item.title: Revisit Anything: Visual Place Recognition via Image Segment Retrieval
item.description: This poses a fundamental challenge in matching two images of the same place captured from different camera viewpoints: "the similarity of what overlaps can be dominated by the dissimilarity of what does not overlap".

item.title: Evaluation of Security of ML-based Watermarking: Copy and Removal Attacks
item.description: While the robustness of these systems is well-documented, the security against adversarial attacks remains underexplored.

item.title: Revisiting Deep Ensemble Uncertainty for Enhanced Medical Anomaly Detection
item.description: To tackle these issues, we propose D2UE, a Diversified Dual-space Uncertainty Estimation framework for medical anomaly detection.

item.title: Shape-intensity knowledge distillation for robust medical image segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to incorporate joint shape-intensity prior information into the segmentation network.

item.title: Prototype based Masked Audio Model for Self-Supervised Learning of Sound Event Detection
item.description: A significant challenge in sound event detection (SED) is the effective utilization of unlabeled data, given the limited availability of labeled data due to high annotation costs.

item.title: Control Industrial Automation System with Large Language Models
item.description: This paper introduces a framework for integrating LLMs to achieve end-to-end control of industrial automation systems.

item.title: PGN: The RNN's New Successor is Effective for Long-Range Time Series Forecasting
item.description: The other branch employs patches to capture short-term information and aggregate the global representation of the series.

item.title: DarkSAM: Fooling Segment Anything Model to Segment Nothing
item.description: In the spatial domain, we disrupt the semantics of both the foreground and background in the image to confuse SAM.

item.title: NeuroPath: A Neural Pathway Transformer for Joining the Dots of Human Connectomes
item.description: Although modern imaging technologies allow us to study connectivity between two distinct brain regions in-vivo, an in-depth understanding of how anatomical structure supports brain function and how spontaneous functional fluctuations emerge remarkable cognition is still elusive.

item.title: MaskLLM: Learnable Semi-Structured Sparsity for Large Language Models
item.description: This approach facilitates end-to-end training on large-scale datasets and offers two notable advantages: 1) High-quality Masks - our method effectively scales to large datasets and learns accurate masks; 2) Transferability - the probabilistic modeling of mask distribution enables the transfer learning of sparsity across domains or tasks.

item.title: Generative Modeling of Molecular Dynamics Trajectories
item.description: We introduce generative modeling of molecular trajectories as a paradigm for learning flexible multi-task surrogate models of MD from data.

item.title: Advancing Open-Set Domain Generalization Using Evidential Bi-Level Hardest Domain Scheduler
item.description: In this paper, we observe that an adaptive domain scheduler benefits more in OSDG compared with prefixed sequential and random domain schedulers.

item.title: Harmful Fine-tuning Attacks and Defenses for Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: We in this paper aim to clear some common concerns for the attack setting, and formally establish the research problem.

item.title: Trustworthy Text-to-Image Diffusion Models: A Timely and Focused Survey
item.description: In this survey, we provide a timely and focused review of the literature on trustworthy T2I DMs, covering a concise-structured taxonomy from the perspectives of property, means, benchmarks and applications.

item.title: Task-recency bias strikes back: Adapting covariances in Exemplar-Free Class Incremental Learning
item.description: In this work, we propose AdaGauss -- a novel method that adapts covariance matrices from task to task and mitigates the task-recency bias owing to the additional anti-collapse loss function.

item.title: E.T. Bench: Towards Open-Ended Event-Level Video-Language Understanding
item.description: Bench (Event-Level & Time-Sensitive Video Understanding Benchmark), a large-scale and high-quality benchmark for open-ended event-level video understanding.

item.title: SimVG: A Simple Framework for Visual Grounding with Decoupled Multi-modal Fusion
item.description: Visual grounding is a common vision task that involves grounding descriptive sentences to the corresponding regions of an image.

item.title: Extracting Affect Aggregates from Longitudinal Social Media Data with Temporal Adapters for Large Language Models
item.description: Our work enables new approaches towards the longitudinal analysis of social media data.

item.title: Preserving logical and functional dependencies in synthetic tabular data
item.description: In addition to the existing notion of functional dependencies, we introduce the notion of logical dependencies among the attributes in this article.

item.title: Let the Quantum Creep In: Designing Quantum Neural Network Models by Gradually Swapping Out Classical Components
item.description: To provide a more fine-grained characterisation of the impact of quantum components on the performance of neural networks, we propose a framework where classical neural network layers are gradually replaced by quantum layers that have the same type of input and output while keeping the flow of information between layers unchanged, different from most current research in quantum neural network, which favours an end-to-end quantum model.

item.title: DMC-VB: A Benchmark for Representation Learning for Control with Visual Distractors
item.description: In this paper, we present theDeepMind Control Visual Benchmark (DMC-VB), a dataset collected in the DeepMind Control Suite to evaluate the robustness of offline RL agents for solving continuous control tasks from visual input in the presence of visual distractors.
